tourName: Lhasa to Everest Base camp private tour
generalInfo: Embark on an unforgettable 8-day private journey from the spiritual heart of Tibet to the foot of the world’s highest mountain. This carefully crafted Lhasa to Everest Base Camp tour blends profound cultural immersion with awe-inspiring natural grandeur, designed for travelers seeking both adventure and meaning. Begin in Lhasa (3,650m), where you’ll explore the majestic Potala Palace—once home to the Dalai Lamas—and wander the sacred Barkhor Street alongside pilgrims. Visit Drepung and Sera monasteries to witness centuries-old Buddhist traditions, including the lively monks’ debates. As you acclimatize, the route unfolds through the stunning Tibetan plateau: picnic beside the turquoise waters of Yamdrok Lake, marvel at the Karola Glacier, and step into the daily life of a local farming family near Gyantse. In Shigatse, discover Tashilhunpo Monastery, seat of the Panchen Lama, before continuing toward the Himalayas. The climax arrives at Rongbuk Monastery—the world’s highest—where you’ll spend an evening under starlit skies gazing at Mount Everest’s north face. Wake before dawn to watch the first golden rays crown the summit, a moment of pure transcendence. Throughout the journey, travel in a comfortable private vehicle with large windows for panoramic views, stay in handpicked Tibetan-run lodgings, and benefit from the insights of knowledgeable local guides. Every element of this itinerary is thoughtfully paced to support safe altitude acclimatization while fostering genuine connections with people and place. More than just a trek to EBC, this is a pilgrimage across landscapes and cultures that have shaped Tibetan identity for millennia—a rare chance to experience the “Roof of the World” with depth, respect, and wonder.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Lhasa. Your private guide and driver will pick you up at Lhasa's airport or train station and accompany you to your hotel. Meals :No meals.
Start your day with a trip to Norbulingka, then visit the biggest and the most important monastery of Tibetan Buddhism, Drepung Monastery. After lunch, visit Sera Monastery and watch a monks' debate.

Visit Potala Palace. Have a walking tour in the afternoon. Visit Jokhang Temple and explore Barkhor Street including its local market, admire traditional Tibetan architecture, and take afternoon tea in peaceful Ani Tsangkhung Nunnery.

Lhasa to Shigatse. Leave for Shigatse via Gyantse. First, you will visit Lake Yamdrok. Along the way, you will view the fabulous scenery of the Karola Glacier.When you stop at Gyantse, visit the town's top attraction Palcho Monastery.

Shigatse to Tingri. Visit Tashilunpo Monastery in Shigatse, which is the residence of Panchen Lamas and then take the drive to Rongbuk Monastery near the Mt. Everest Base Camp. The journey from Shigatse to Tingri takes about 6½ hours by car, but you will not get bored: there are stunning views along the way.

Tingri to Shigatse. Experience the unforgettable moment of watching the sunrise paint Mount Everest in gold. Visit Rongbuk Monastery near Mt. Everest Base Camp, and see the hard life of the monks and nuns there. Talk with a lama. After visiting the monastery, you will be driven back to Shigatse.
Shigatse to Lhasa. After breakfast in your hotel, you will be driven back to Lhasa. The journey takes about 6 hours, but there is marvelous scenery on the way.
Your guide and driver will take you to Lhasa's airport or train station on time for your departure.
